etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Handfield Jones (1819–1890), physician and histologist. From scientific Latin myoma from myo- + -oma

definitions: A benign tumour of muscular origin; especially a leiomyoma (fibroid) of the uterus.

notes.text: Now more common with distinguishing prefix: see "leiomyoma", rhabdomyoma.
